newsitem.title: UK: Euro fuel barges $81/$82 amid holiday torpor.
newsitem.headline: Euro fuel barges $81/$82 amid holiday torpor.

text.p: NWE fuel oil barge prices gained $1 on Thursday as the Dutch returned to work, but with most of the rest of Europe on holiday little was done, traders said.
One barge was heard traded at $81.50 fob ARA. Offers were at $82 for start May and $82.50 or $83 further out, a gain of about $1 from Tuesday.
But much of the talk was notional with so many European players off for the May Day break.
"The whole world is closed so there is very little getting done," said a trader.
Cargo markets were thin, although one player was heard looking to cover a high sulphur short into a utility.
"We're in a stand-off on the high sulphur. Nobody is really chasing firm offers," one purchaser said.
Bids were in the mid $70's while there was talk of offers over $80.
Straight-run was quiet, with no activity predicted until next week. However a Russian M40 was being offered in the Mediterranean.
Two Gibraltar bunker cargo requirements were believed filled by the same seller on Wednesday with Bilbao barrels, one at a fob price of fob high quotes plus between $1 and $1.50.
